Posts.Title: 14 positive nodes ... can i survive? Syl1969 Jubby

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2013 02:16PM ericam wrote: Good Morning, Thank you for your response MSSWISS....Yes, occult breast cancer is very rare indeed - it accounts for only .04% of breast cancer patients.  I am not rh- so I don't think the blood type has anything to do with occult cancer.  I have started chemo and now am on my 4th day of round 2 of AC (what's referred to as Red Devil only because of the color and toxicity).  I have felt fine (knock on wood) most likely due to the abundant amount of anti-nauesa drugs they give you.  I did have a great deal of weakness and dehydration with the numelasta shot (boosts your WBC) the first round but have kept the pain in check with pain medication.  I have 2 more treatments of the AC chemo, administered every 2 weeks and then start the T phase of chemo once a week for 12 weeks.  After chemo I will have radiation therapy for 6 weeks 5 times a week.  I would imagine your treatment will be very similar since the protocol is the same for our cancer type.  I'm sending an abundant amount of support and positive vibes and pls write whenever you want. Erica
Posts.Title: Occult Breast Cancer ericam ericam

Posts.Content: ericam wrote: In Oct 2012 I was diagnosed with occult breast cancer.  My primary physician was concerned about my elevated WBC and sent me to a hemotologist oncologist.  Upon physical examination she discovered a mass under my left arm and said it was either breast cancer or lymphoma.  I had surgery to remove the left axillary lymph node - grade 3, ER pos, Prog pos, HER neg and very differenciated.  Had all the tests, MRI'S, PET, CT, ECHO 4 MRI guided biopsies of both breasts all cancer free.  My surgeon suggested a mastectomy (he didn't biopsy the breast) and a friend of mine suggested a second opinion.  Second opinion totally disagreed with original surgeon did the MRI guided biopsy of left breast no cancer.  Then had 15 additional nodes removed and all were clean.  At the surgeons suggestion I decided not to have a masectomy and will soon begin chemo then radiation therapy.  It's just so unnerving not knowing where the primary is and scary at the same time.  Has anyone else been diagnosed with occult breast cancer? Erica Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Occult Breast Cancer ericam ericam

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2012 04:47PM ericam wrote: Likewise, I was in shock when I recently found out I have occult breast cancer.  Primary source unknown but my axillary node was grade 3 ER+PR+HER-highly differenciated and very aggressive.  But I then had 15 nodes removed and all cancer free....I am not having a masectomy as my surgeon said with occult BC they treat it like stage 2 BC and results are the same.  Aggressive treatment-5 months chemo then localized radiation therapy.  It's very very frustrating! Erica
